tags

Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • tags.Tag
      • tags.Rule

  • public final class Rule
extends Tag
    Represents a rule in the expert system.

    Rules are many-to-many structures with Facts as inputs and Predicates (Facts and Recommendations) as outputs. They only activate when all the input Facts are active.

      • Rule

        public Rule(java.util.Set<Fact> inputFacts,
            java.util.Set<Predicate> outputPredicates,
            double confidence)
        Creates a Rule from a set of input Facts and output Predicates.

        Confidence value of output tags set to the product of the confidence value of input tags.

        Parameters:
        inputFacts - The condition facts of the rule.
        outputPredicates - The output predicates of the rule.
        confidence - The confidence value of the Rule.

    • Method Detail

      • makeRules

        public static java.util.List<Rule> makeRules(java.lang.String value)
        Creates Rule(s) from a single String.

        Example of a rule string:

        "P1(ARG1,ARG2) P2(ARG3) -> @P3(ARG4,ARG5,ARG6)"

        NB: 1. Tags are separated by " " 2. arguments with a fact tag are separated by "," 3. all facts on the left of "->" are input facts, on the right are output tags 4. if an output tag is preceeded by "@", it is a recommendation, otherwise it is a fact

        NB: rules may include OR: "P1(ARG1,ARG2) P2(ARG3) OR P3(ARG4,ARG5) P4(ARG6,ARG7) -> @P3(ARG4,ARG5,ARG6)" in this case, two rules are returned "P1(ARG1,ARG2) P2(ARG3) -> @P3(ARG4,ARG5,ARG6)" and "P3(ARG4,ARG5) P4(ARG6,ARG7) -> @P3(ARG4,ARG5,ARG6)"

        Parameters:
        value - the Rule as string.
        Returns:
        List of Rules.
